author: BogusException
body:
# Documentation Issue

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/developer/cmdlet/cmdlet-parameter-sets

As you might expect, PS has a difficult time running it...

comments.author: vexx32
comments.body:
Cmdlets are typically defined in C# as classes that inherit from `Cmdlet` or `PSCmdlet`.

Much of the "developer" documentation will be in C#, as it is cumbersome at the moment to define a true cmdlet in PowerShell itself.

Advanced functions can use parameter sets, but have some pretty key differences in their operation compared to cmdlets.

title: Why is there a C# example on a cmdlet page for Parameter Sets?
